SENTRY INDUSTRIES INC.

RISK MANAGEMENT EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

Since the founding of Sentry Industries in 1984, it has always been our company?s policy to operate our facility in a manner and way to protect our employees, our community, and the environment. Through our policies, procedures and actions, our goal is to prevent accidents and chemical releases. Sentry Industries maintains our facility in accordance with all local, state, and federal requirements. Sentry Industries is an active member in the Chlorine Institute and follows the recommendations for the safe handling of chlorine. Sentry Industries is also a member of the Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC) District 11.

Sentry Industries manufactures and distributes swimming pool supplies to wholesalers and service companies throughout South Florida. Sentry Industries manufactures sodium hypochlorite (bleach), along with other goods and services, which is used to sanitize private and public swimming pools and in the sanitization of drinking water and wastewater treatment.  

Sentry Industries Risk Management Plan encompasses the following written procedures:

1. Standard Operating Procedures 
2. Preventative Maintenance Procedures 
3. Operator Training Programs
4. Safety Manual
5. Chemical Accident Prevention Plan
6. Site Emergency Response Plan
7. Accident Investigation Procedures
8. Fleet Safety Manual
9. Site Security Program

In the manufacturing process of sodium hypochlorite bleach, elemental chlorine is used, which is a regulated substance under both EPA's Risk Management Plan rule and OSHA's Process Safety Management of Highly Hazardous Materials rule. 

Sentry Industries has taken the following steps to ensure our safe handling of chlorine in the community:

?* ?State of the art valve closure system to close the valves on the railcar and the process piping system in case of railcar movement, detection of chlorine released to the atmosphere, safety equipment failure, loss of utilities including ele

ctric and air, and remote emergency switches to manually operate emergency shutdown.
?* Redundant safety systems.
?* All systems designed and operated per industry standards and codes.
?* Chlorine gas monitoring system that will shut the railcar car valves and systems down and alert plant personnel, if it detects as little as 0.5 ppm chlorine released to the atmosphere.
?* Comply with OSHA Process Safety Management rule and EPA's Risk Management Plan.
?* Equipment checks and preventative maintenance programs in place.
?* Purchase of chlorine in railcars only from suppliers that conform to all Federal safety requirements for railcars and follow the Chlorine Institute recommendation for railcar loading and maintenance.
?* Procedures in place for the safe movement of railcars in and out of our secure railcar siding.
?* Only trained personnel allowed to receive, connect and disconnect chlorine railcars.
?* Written Standard Operating Procedures for operators to follow.
?* Annual auditing of procedures and operations.
?* A chlorine scrubber system to pull a vacuum on hoses and piping systems.
?* Work with all state and local agencies to improve not only our safety, but also the industries safety commitment overall.
?* Security procedures and employee training for the protection of our employees, the community, and the environment, as well as, protection of the company assets.
?* Sentry Industries, has a Site Emergency Response Plan (SERP) that has been coordinated with the community plan.  We have and will continue to work with the local fire department though training and drills to improve our response to any problem that may arise.

In the past five years, Sentry Industries has NOT experienced an accidental release of chlorine and has been recognized by the Chlorine Institute in March of 2004, with an Environmental Achievement Award.
